turns.seeker_message: My younger brother, Rafael, was killed in the clashes near the docks last year. It’s been six months, but I still feel hollow—can’t eat, can’t sleep. Here in Havana, everyone’s struggling, and my family won’t even talk about him. It’s like his memory is another burden we’re forced to carry in silence.
